title: How to describe a character in my story that's a bigger size than other characters without sounding offensive - Quora

response.answer_text: Apart from not using words like “obese” or “fatty”, the best thing to do is to let the character say something that indicates their size. “I wish that dress/shirt/belt/whatever came in my size” “That chair looks a bit too fragile for me” “I’m not really suited to Parkour” “I’m taking part in the Healthy At Any Size parade next week” “Do you think I’m make a good plus size model?” And so on, in a way appropriate to the story and scene. The comment can be any tone, from serious to self mockery. Of course there might be another character who is being deliberately offensive, which means you can approach the topic directly.
You mean, he can’t sit on a two-person bus seat? Just do it. Stand out, be different. If you don’t offend somebody, the why bother writing?
